intro: Rajania tenuiflora, commonly known as the slender-flowered rajania, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to the eastern Himalayas. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal potential, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists.
